main event: A bright, luminous object was observed in the sky near Elkhart Lake, Wisconsin for several minutes on August 2, 1960.
interesting points: The object was described as a luminous, sharply outlined object that was bright in the center and red-orange in color.
The object disappeared suddenly after being visible for several minutes.
The witness thought the object might have been caused by the navigation light of a small plane.
Another witness reported seeing a fast-moving, oval-shaped and very bright object that seemed to be glowing from within on August 26, 1960.
The witness believed the object was not a conventional aircraft.
